text.p: Recall the proposition we just proved:

Proposition. If [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B} = \{ v_1; v_2; \ldots ; v_ n\}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline], and [mathjaxinline]k>v[/mathjaxinline], then any list of [mathjaxinline]k[/mathjaxinline] vectors in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] must be linearly dependent.

Now suppose that [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B}[/mathjaxinline] is a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline] with 5 vectors, and let [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{C}[/mathjaxinline] be a list of 7 vectors in [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]. Is it possible for [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{C}[/mathjaxinline] to be a basis of [mathjaxinline]V[/mathjaxinline]?
